cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles WNW of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift west-northwest briefly, then turn south on Friday and remain over the east-central Gulf of Mexico before weakening into a remnant low by Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system expected to stay over open Gulf waters

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mainly central-eastern Gulf of Mexico from the Florida Big Bend southward toward the Yucatán Channel
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: GFMX 290N 870W (approximately 210 km W of the storm center)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 1–3" with isolated 6" totals over S-central FL)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy periods possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of 1–3 inches of rain possible through Saturday from unrelated moisture plume; isolated urban flooding probable
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional lightning in rain bands; minor disruptions to small craft operations offshore
